servinfo.title: DTC P2102: Throttle Actuator Control Motor Circuit Low

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P2101: Throttle Actuator Control Motor Circuit Range / Performance .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Power supply voltage of throttle actuator control circuit is less than 5 V for specified time even if throttle actuator control relay is turned on.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Start engine and run it for 1 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check

testgroup.title: Throttle actuator control relay circuit check

test1.ptxt: Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-50” and “E23-17” terminals.
Measure voltage between “E23-17” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

testgroup.question: Is voltage 10 – 14 V?

action.ptxt: Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is “THR MOT” fuse in good condition?

action.ptxt: Replace fuse and check for short in circuits connected to this fuse.

testgroup.title: Throttle actuator control relay circuit check

test1.ptxt: Remove throttle actuator control relay from relay box with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to throttle actuator control relay at “BLU/BLK”, “BLU/RED”, “BLU/ORN” and “GRN” wire terminals.
Measure voltage between engine ground and each “BLU/BLK”, “BLU/RED” wire terminal with ignition switch turned ON.

testgroup.question: Is each voltage 10 – 14 V?

action.ptxt: “BLU/BLK” wire and/or “BLU/RED” wire is open or high resistance.

testgroup.title: Throttle actuator control relay circuit check

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance at following connector terminals.

item.ptxt: Between “BLU/ORN” wire terminal of throttle actuator control relay connector and “E23-50” terminal of ECM connector
Between “GRN” wire terminal of throttle actuator control relay connector and “E23-17” terminal of ECM connector

testgroup.question: Is each resistance below 3 Ω?

action.ptxt: “BLU/ORN” wire and/or “GRN” wire is open or high resistance.

test1.ptxt: Check throttle actuator control relay referring to Control Relay Inspection .

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
